com.epoch.db

Class DBCommon

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epoch.db.DBCommon
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CanonicalizedUnitRW, CourseRW, DataConversion, DBTables, EnrollmentRW, FnalGroupDefRW, ForumRW, HWRead, HWWrite, ImageRW, InstitutionRW, QSetRW, QuestionRead, QuestionRW, QuestionWrite, ReactorResultsRW, ResponseLogger, ResponseRead, ResponseWrite, RGroupCollectionRW, SQLWithQMarks, SynthDataRW, TextbookRW, TranslnRead, TranslnWrite, UnitConvertRW, UserRead, UserWrite

    public class DBCommon
extends Object
    Stores common SQL words and provides utility functions for running a single update query, to get a pool connection, and to format SQL expressions.

    This class acts as superclass to all db classes so they can access its constants and methods without using a prefix.

      • tryUpdate

        protected static int tryUpdate(Connection con,
                               String doThis)
                        throws SQLException
        Executes a database update (INSERT INTO, UPDATE, DELETE FROM). Use only when there are no pieces of data included in the SQL; if there are, use ? in the SQL and tryUpdate() with variable arguments.
        Parameters:
        con - database connection
        doThis - SQL statement
        Returns:
        number of rows affected
        Throws:
        SQLException - if there's a problem writing to the database

      • tryUpdate

        protected static int tryUpdate(Connection con,
                               String qry,
                               Object... data)
                        throws SQLException
        Executes a database update (INSERT INTO, UPDATE, DELETE FROM) with one or more pieces of data to be inserted into the SQL.
        Parameters:
        con - database connection
        qry - database query beginning:
        UPDATE table_name SET ... field_name = ?, ...
        with any number of fields set to ?.
        Can also be used with INSERT INTO and DELETE FROM statements.
        data - data to store
        Returns:
        number of rows affected
        Throws:
        SQLException - if there's a problem writing to the database

      • tryUpdate

                               SQLWithQMarks sql_vals)
                        throws SQLException
        Executes a database update (INSERT INTO, UPDATE, DELETE FROM) with one or more pieces of data to be inserted into the SQL.
        Parameters:
        con - database connection
        sql_vals - SQL to execute, and values to substitute for question marks
        Returns:
        number of rows affected
        Throws:
        SQLException - if there's a problem writing to the database

      • setValue

        protected static int setValue(PreparedStatement stmt,
                              int dataNum,
                              Object datum)
                       throws SQLException
        Sets a datum for a question mark in a PreparedStatement when the datum is of an unknown type.
        Parameters:
        stmt - the PreparedStatement
        dataNum - which question mark will be substituted; 1-based
        datum - the datum, as an Object
        Returns:
        the next datum number, usually dataNum +1, but may be larger if the datum is an array
        Throws:
        SQLException - if there's a problem setting the value

      • trim

        protected static StringBuilder trim(String field,
                                    int leftTrim,
                                    int rightTrim)
        Gets a substring of a field, which may be a CLOB field.
        Parameters:
        field - a field
        leftTrim - number of characters to trim from the left
        rightTrim - number of characters to trim from the right
        Returns:
        a StringBuilder containing dbms_lob.substr(field, length(field) - (leftTrim + rightTrim), leftTrim + 1) which has the effect of returning the value trimmed by the appropriate number of characters on the left and right

      • insertWhereNotAlready

        protected static StringBuilder insertWhereNotAlready(String table,
                                                     String[] fields,
                                                     String[] insertValues,
                                                     int numConditionals)
        Gets SQL to insert into a table if a record doesn't already exist: 
                INSERT INTO table (fields[0], fields[1], ...)
                SELECT values[0], values[1], ... FROM dual
                WHERE NOT EXISTS 
                        (SELECT '1' FROM table 
                        WHERE fields[0] = values[0] 
                        AND fields[1] = values[1]
                        AND ...);
        Parameters:
        table - the table into which to insert
        fields - the table's fields
        insertValues - the values to be inserted, as strings with string values already enquoted
        numConditionals - the number of inserted values that need to be checked for already being in the table
        Returns:
        the SQL

        protected static void appendTo(StringBuilder bld,
                               Object... items)
        Combines all the objects into the StringBuilder.
        Parameters:
        bld - the StringBuilder
        items - the items to be combined into a string
